content: MADRID, May 4 (Reuters) - The number of people registering as jobless in Spain fell by 2.58% in April from a month earlier, or by 73,890, leaving a total of 2.79 million people out of work, data from the Labour Ministry showed on Thursday.

The total unemployment figure in April is the lowest for a month of April since 2008 when it was 2.34 million people.Spain gained 128,824 net formal jobs in April to 20.66 million jobs, a separate report from the Social Security Ministry said. (Reporting by Maria Luiza Amaral, editing by Inti Landauro)
